Question
========

Which of the following statements IS correct?

Answerlist
----------

*  There can only be one correct to identify the structural break  
*  The structural break can be detected by comparing heterogeneity of the the time series subsets with heterogeneity of the entire series
*  Usually it's enough to consider only one structural break
*  Structural break detection algorithms should be applied to initial time series 

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

*  False. Point of changes of the series behavior is subjective and depends on data and underlying model.
*  True.
*  False. This depends on data, multiple structural breaks can be as probable as single ones.
*  False. They can be applied to transformed data as well as to individual components
